fsdict::Instruction

fsdict::Instruction Class Reference

Instruction is a std::vector< PosPattern>, and it's an instruction in the sense we use the word in connection with spelling variants. More...

Detailed Description

Instruction is a std::vector< PosPattern>, and it's an instruction in the sense we use the word in connection with spelling variants.

void fsdict::Instruction::applyTo ( std::wstring *  str,
int  direction = 1 
) const

apply the instruction to the string passed as pointer argument

Parameters:
in/out] str the string that is to be changed by the instruction
[in] If set to -1, replaces right sides for left sides

Note that at the moment the method does not check if the instruction is applicable to str, i.e. it does not check if the left sides of the patterns really occur in str at the given positions. If the instruction specifies a transformation beyond the word border, most likely an exception will be thrown.

Todo:
make this method more secure, at least handle the exception that are maybe thrown by std::wstring::replace
bool fsdict::Instruction::containsPattern ( Pattern const &  pat  )  const

return true if the Instruction contains the given pattern.

In the current implementation this needs a linear run through the instruction.
